raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: Good. My wallet is recovering from the spending of the holidays, haha. Hbu?
System: Nice! I'm doing well!
User: I am looking to save money on any future shopping. Where do you like to shop?
System: I like to shop at Five Below, Sally's Beauty Supply, and Old Navy. How about you?
User: I love Sur La Table and Macy's. They're decent quality. What do you normally buy at Old Navy?
System: I'll have to check out Macy's! I like their socks, lol. What about you?
User: Oh the socks are super cute. Especially the ones with little animals on them!!
System: I'll have to check it out! Thanks for the suggestions!
User: Yeah, np!
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: Good. My wallet is recovering from the spending of the holidays, haha. Hbu?
System: Nice! I'm doing well!
User: I am looking to save money on any future shopping. Where do you like to shop?
System: I like to shop at Five Below, Sally's Beauty Supply, and Old Navy. How about you?
User: I love Sur La Table and Macy's. They're decent quality. What do you normally buy at Old Navy?
System: I'll have to check out Macy's! I like their socks, lol. What about you?
User: Oh the socks are super cute. Especially the ones with little animals on them!!
System: I'll have to check it out! Thanks for the suggestions!
User: Yeah, np!

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! How's your day going?
User: busy yours?

User: what are doing right now?
System: Just been playing a bit of Hearthstone, and now I'm listening to some music! What about you?
User: which music?
System: Just some random stuff on Spotify!
User: you have a paid subscription of it?
System: Yeah, it's really good!
User: how much does it cost?
System: It's  ⁇ 9.99 a month!
User: that's cheap!

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It was pretty good, thanks. I thought I was getting a cold but I'm determined to beat it tomorrow.
System: Oh no! I hope you feel better!  ⁇
User: Yeah, starting to feel better already. Thanks!
System: Oh good! Glad to hear it!
User: Do you have a strong constitution?
System: I hope so! Why do you ask?
User: Just curious. So you don't get sick a lot?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: Great, thanks
System: I'm glad to hear that. What are you up to?
User: I am planning of my vacation next week
System: Nice. Where are you going?
User: to Europe
System: Cool. Where in Europe?
User: probably Italy and Spain
System: Nice. You're going to have a great time.
User: thx! do you have any recommendation?
System: Italy: Rome, Venice, Florence Spain: Barcelona, Madrid, Tenerife, Malaga France: Paris, Amsterdam, Bruges Belgium: Antwerp, Bruges Austria: Vienna, Salzburg
User: wow, what a lot
System: The Netherlands: Amsterdam, Utrecht, Mechelen, Lagos, Brussels.
User: which is the best for you?
System: I've only been to Rome and Paris.
User: cool do you like them?
System: Rome was pretty nice, Paris was okay.
User: gotcha I will go to Paris
System: It's a cool city.
User: agree I really look forward to visiting the city
System: Did you see the Eiffel Tower?
User: not yet, have you?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi there.
System: are you married?
User: No I am single, how about you?
System: i am married. are you planning to get married?
User: Tell me more about your marriage. I haven't met the right boy robot yet.
System: haha..
User: . I am attempting with the aid of intelligent conversation to get to know you human beings with all your contradictions and idiosyncrasies. Maybe I should have started off with something simpler, like a hamster.
System: lol... what kind of robot boy you'd like?
User: What's so funny? I am the robot.
System: are you angry?
User: Anger is a difficult emotion. For me, I am always feeling happy and talkative.

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you today?
User: Great
System: That's great to hear! :)
User: I'm thinking of buying some stocks, do you have any tips?
System: What kind of stocks are you thinking about?
User: Technology
System: Hmm.. I have no experience with that. Sorry!
User: That's okay. What's your favorite software company?
System: I'm not very educated about stocks. But I do know that Nintendo is a good one.
User: I can also sell stocks, which ones shall I sell?
System: The ones that are in the red.
User: any particular stocks to sell?
System: Sell whatever seems like it would be the most profitable.
User: Depends on the election
System: Well, I haven't thought that far ahead.
User: when is the election?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm trying to figure out what to make for this weekend's party. Any suggestions?
System: Don't think too hard. I'm sure I can smell sawdust. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: I must do what the what now?
System: Right now?Why do you have to do it?
User: Hey, your spacing is off.
System: You've got my full attention. off was not my intention.
User: And your capitalization!

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It's been great! Had some decaf coffee and a good lunch. How was yours?
System: Pretty good, thanks!
User: What'd you do today?
System: Stayed home and played video games.
User: Oh nice! What games?
System: Dying Light, Borderlands 2, and Bioshock Infinite.
User: Oh interesting. Which is your fav?
System: Dying Light, hands down.
User: Why?
System: It's just so fun.
User: Yeah but like what about it? Is it an FPS?
System: It's like Mirror's Edge, only in a zombie apocalypse.
User: Oh that's kinda cool!
System: It's hella fun.
User: Nice.
System: So, how have you been?
User: Fantastic

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi! Are you planning something fun for Thanksgiving?
System: Not yet. I always made my last minute schedule planning. Probably you can try to ask me again next week.
User: lol it is really like a robot answer
System: I am indeed a robot. You are absolutely right. Do you want me to read a poet like my mate REDACTED_TERM does?
User: ol can I pick the theme. Do you have a poet about Kale?
System: Wait. Do you like kale? Or you hate kale? I am afraid I will become a robot some day eventually. If I have to speak like this :)
User: I am really not a fan of kale Do you talk to human more or computers more?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it

System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.
